content.description: Narrow chimney. Requires a top rope set by someone who has considerable experience building anchors.
content.protection: As of this posting, there are no fixed anchors. Requires a top rope set by someone who has experience building anchors.
content.location: As you enter Carol Lamb’s Bedroom from the right passageway (walking between between Sprecher Brew Co and Sir Mix-a-Lot), look for the first overhead boulder that joins the two walls. This route is on the side of the boulder closest to the trail (farthest from Carol Lamb’s Bedroom).

content.description: Climb the right crack, protecting when necessary. When the main crack system ends, pull over a small roof and climb the last crack section and top out the route.
content.protection: Standard rack to No. 3. Currently a top out climb. No anchor
content.location: The right crack in the bedroom

content.description: Begin in the left crack. Work your way up to a small roof, cut left with the crack, and continue up.
content.location: Left corner crack when you enter the bedroom

content.description: Narrow chimney. Requires a top rope set by someone who has experience building anchors.
content.protection: As of this posting, there are no fixed anchors. Requires a top rope set by someone who has experience building anchors.
content.location: As you enter Carol Lamb’s Bedroom from the right passageway (walking between between Sprecher Brew Co and Sir Mix-a-Lot), look for the first overhead boulder that joins the two walls. This route is on the side of the boulder farthest from the trail (closest to Carol Lamb’s Bedroom).

content.description: Hidden through a narrow hallway, this area lies behind the Quetil Trail cliff line. Inside a square shaped corridor lies the inscription of Carol Lamb.
